Posts.Content: momto3kites wrote: Hi ladies,     I am new to posting here, but have been reading for over a month.  I'm here because I would love your thoughts and opinions on my situation.  But first, let me start by saying, that I have admired each and everyone of you who have been through the waiting, testing, results, and diagnosis, treatments, and recoveries.  Your all heroes in my eyes and I take great comfort in your thoughts and opinions.      I'm 39 with 3 children, the youngest being 2.  I found a lump in my breast while itching on Nov 7.  It felt kind of small and pea size.  But seemed to get bigger from the time I felt it to the time I saw the surgeon................a hard pea on top and just a mass around it. If that makes sense.  I got into my ob/gyn a week later and he did an exam.  He said he felt the lump and found another (I have never been able to feel this other one).  He set me up for mammo and ultrasound.  I met with a surgeon (general)  Dec 3 for the radiology results.  The mammo stated benign mass (solid) found...........Birad 1.  The ultrasound showed nothing with a Birad of 0.   The surgeon basically read the report word for word.  He didn't ask to look at my mammo or ultrasound films or go over them with my husband and I.  He said it probably got bigger because I was touching it too much.  He said we should take it out and that it was probably a fibroadenoma, he doubted it was cancer.  He said it may just keep getting bigger and if I have it taken out we could do a biopsy on it to make sure it's not cancer.  Unfortunately, he's out of my network so now I'm searching for another surgeon.  I'm trying to find a surgeon that specializes in the breast, but I'm not having much luck.  Should I just go ahead and have a lumpectomy with a general surgeon?  Should I see another surgeon and get a second opinion?  And should I be making this a priority or do you think I have time to find a new surgeon and schedule surgery for after the holidays. I have to say I'm no longer a mad mess since they said this lump is benign.  I thought I was going to lose my mind during the waiting process, but I do feel a bit relieved now.  But at the same time I have this weighing in the back of my mind.  I don't think I will totally convinced until the biopsy in done and comes back negative.  Thank you all very very much for your support, thoughts and opinions.  God bless you!!! Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Benign mass found, now what? momto3kites LISAMG

Posts.Content: Feb 25, 2010 03:04PM momto3kites wrote: For some reason I thought I'd be down a couple to a few days with this lumpectomy.  If it isn't going to be that bad, maybe I should stay with the surgery date of the 11th and continue on with the party plans on the 13th.   I thought of doing both, but I don't want to go and be in pain or be a downer, know what I mean.  Did you both have lumpectomies and were you up and about a day or two later?   Idaho, no, I have no clue if it's cancer or not, that's why they are taking it out and sending it to pathology.  The thought that it could be is what is so hard.................the waiting, the waiting, and the waiting.  Like I mentioned above, just praying for b9 results once it's all said and done.  Thank you again for your help and support!
Posts.Title: lumpectomy is finally scheduled, but I'm feeling selfish momto3kites momto3kites

Posts.Content: Feb 26, 2010 07:05PM momto3kites wrote: Thank you all very much for your thoughts, opinions, and perspectives.  I haven't cancelled surgery thus far, but it has been weighing on me.  I think I will do as you ladies have suggested and keep my surgery planned for the 11th as I just don't want to put myself through another month of waiting.  And if I feel good, I will go to the party, and if not, I will stay home and recover.  If I am able to make it to the party I think it will definitely help me keep my mind off things for a day or so, so that would be a good thing  You ladies remind me of superman, your so strong and giving!!!!   Dtol, I hope you are doing and feeling well today.  I'm sorry that you too had to have a lumpectomy.  If you don't mind me asking, what was your lumpectomy for?  Happy healing.  I'm hoping you haven't already been diagnosed and that you are doing a small waiting game for benign results.  I'll keep you ladies posted when I actually know more. Thanks again!!!
Posts.Title: lumpectomy is finally scheduled, but I'm feeling selfish momto3kites momto3kites

Posts.Content: Mar 2, 2010 09:41AM momto3kites wrote: Dtol,     I will keep you in my thoughts and prayers.  Praying the cyst is b9!!!  And thank you for sharing with me.  Today is Tuesday, I'll be thinking of you and hoping you get nothing but good news.  Positive vibes coming your way.  Please let us know what you find out.  Stacey
Posts.Title: lumpectomy is finally scheduled, but I'm feeling selfish momto3kites momto3kites

Posts.Content: momto3kites wrote: Hi ladies,     My lumpectomy and dnc (having both at same time) have finally been scheduled for March 11 after months of doctor visits, tests, and legwork.  You would think that I would feel relieved, but I'm an emotional mess right now.  Not sure if it's because I'm sick with a cold and major sinus infection and on the second week of my period, or if it's just getting more real now (super scared), or a combo of everything.  Anyways, this 3cm mass near my chest wall has been here since Nov and as we all know the waiting is the toughest part ever.  It's such an emotional roller coaster that it could literally send me to the crazy house.   I try not to share much with anyone because I don't think anyone will understand, so I'm keeping most thoughts and feelings to myself.  And of course I don't want people to worry needlessly.     If I could please get some of your thoughts and opinions on this that would be wonderful, even if it's just to hear what you would do in my situation.  I told the scheduling nurse that I did not want my surgeries close to the weekend of March 13 because we had plans (it's our friends 40th birthday bash).  Her husband is renting a house in Palm Springs, sending all the women to the spa for the day for massages, facials, citrus baths, and relaxation.  And the men will play golf.  Then we will all meet up, get ready, and head out for a nice dinner and celebration.  He is paying for everything. So this has been a plan for a few weeks now and then I get the call yesterday that my surgeries are scheduled for March 11, ugh!   I don't know if I should reschedule the surgeries after all this...............do you think it would hurt anything to wait another month, because that's how long I'd have to wait.  I'm feeling so torn that I can't think straight.  I want this mass out of me and tested, so that I can move on with my life.  It's basically held me hostage for the last 4 months.  However, I feel the pressure to keep our plans for the birthday bash.  What would you ladies do?  No one else can even get what it's like to walk in our shoes and sit and wonder what is going on inside our bodies, unless of course they have been there.  So I don't feel that my husband gets it, or my friends would get it, I feel that I would be letting everyone down if I go through with my surgery.  Sad huh?  Any input is appreciated.  And I'm sorry for the long long ramble.  But like I said, I am an emotional mess right now, thinking about the "what ifs".  Thank you all for your continued support and I'm praying for b9 results for me and you.  Continued thoughts and prayers go out to those of you who have already been diagnosed.....................I'm wishing you all much strength, hope, courage and faith!!!!  ~Stacey Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: lumpectomy is finally scheduled, but I'm feeling selfish momto3kites momto3kites
